did.unittitle: Shelter Island Meeting House Committee petition and subscription list
did.abstract: A copy of a circa 1800 petition and subscription list requesting donations to erect a new meeting house on Shelter Island.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1977.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Shelter Island Meeting House Committee petition and subscription list, c. 1800, 1977.649, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A copy of a petition and subscription list requesting donations to erect a new meeting house on Shelter Island. The list was only signed by two people, Benjamin and Gilbert Horton. The committee consisted of five men: Sylvester Dering, Samuel Lord, William Bavditch, Jonathan Douglass, and Henry Conklin.
